Test uniformity using Kolmogorov-Smirnov and Chi-squared tests

Source: R/discriminant_tests.R
test_uniformity.Rd

Performs comprehensive uniformity testing on a sample of random numbers using both the Kolmogorov-Smirnov test and Chi-squared goodness-of-fit test.

Usage

test_uniformity(samples, bins = 20)

Arguments

samples

Numeric vector of random samples to test

bins

Number of bins for the Chi-squared test (default: 20)

Value

A list containing test results:

test_name

Name of the test suite

ks_statistic

Kolmogorov-Smirnov test statistic

ks_p_value

Kolmogorov-Smirnov p-value

chi_sq_statistic

Chi-squared test statistic

chi_sq_p_value

Chi-squared p-value

passed

Logical; TRUE if both tests pass at 0.05 significance

interpretation

Human-readable interpretation of results

Details

The function performs two complementary tests:

  • Kolmogorov-Smirnov test: Compares the empirical CDF against uniform0,1

  • Chi-squared test: Tests if bin frequencies match expected uniform distribution

A warning is issued if expected bin counts are less than 5, as this may affect the validity of the Chi-squared test.

Note

Both tests must pass (p-value > 0.05) for the overall test to pass.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Test uniform random numbers
samples <- runif(10000)
result <- test_uniformity(samples)
print(result$interpretation)
} # }
